verses.roman:
gaccha dvāravatīṁ sūta
jñātīnāṁ nidhanaṁ mithaḥ
saṅkarṣaṇasya niryāṇaṁ
bandhubhyo brūhi mad-daśām

synonyms: gaccha—just go; dvāravatīm—to Dvārakā; sūta—O chariot driver; jñātīnām—of their close relatives; nidhanam—the destruction; mithaḥ—mutual; saṅkarṣaṇasya—of Lord Balarāma; niryāṇam—the passing away; bandhubhyaḥ—to Our family members; brūhi—speak; mat-daśām—My condition.
translation: O driver, go to Dvārakā and tell Our family members how their loved ones destroyed one another. Also tell them of the disappearance of Lord Saṅkarṣaṇa and of My present condition.

purport.content: Lord Kṛṣṇa sent His chariot driverless back to Vaikuṇṭha, along with the horses and weapons, because the chariot driver, Dāruka, had some final service to do on earth.
